doc.previous: In greatest dimension, the island is 93 miles (150Â km) across and has a land area of 4,028 square miles (10,430Â km2)[7] comprising 62% of the Hawaiian Islands' land area. Measured from its sea floor base to its highest peak, Mauna Kea is the world's tallest mountain, taller than Mount Everest is, with Everest being above sea level.[8]
